data.title: Frances Langford
data.meta_description: Frances Langford. Actress: The Hit Parade. Frances Langford won fame on radio (primarily as Bob Hope's vocalist, later sparring comically with Don Ameche as "The Bickersons"), via recordings and in the movies. In spite of the fact that she played mostly in minor musicals (plus appearing occasionally in "A" productions, including Yankee Doodle Dandy (1942), This Is the Army (1943) and Die Glenn Miller Story (1954)), she introduced major songs...
data.text: Frances Langford won fame on radio (primarily as Bob Hope's vocalist, later sparring comically with Don Ameche as "The Bickersons"), via recordings and in the movies. In spite of the fact that she played mostly in minor musicals (plus appearing occasionally in "A" productions, including Yankee Doodle Dandy (1942), This Is the Army (1943) and Die Glenn Miller Story (1954)), she introduced major songs like "I'm in the Mood for Love" in Jeden Abend um acht (1935), "You are My Lucky Star" and "Broadway Rhythm" in Broadway-Melodie 1936 (1935), Cole Porter's "Easy to Love" in Zum Tanzen geboren (1936) and "Hooray for Hollywood" in Hollywood Hotel (1937).
